intro: Silene hookeri subsp. typica, commonly known as Hooker's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its subspecies typica is distinguished by its specific morphological features, including the shape and size of its leaves and flowers. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
